item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I built an app to get daily wisdom from Mr. Worldwide (101 points | 33 comments)
2. Presenterm: Markdown Slideshows in the Terminal (113 points | 23 comments)
3. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers (414 points | 151 comments)
4. "Big 3" science fiction magazines including Asimov's and Analog acquired (83 points | 37 comments)
5. Roald Dahl on the death of his daughter (2015) (25 points | 3 comments)
6. The DOJ still wants Google to sell off Chrome (208 points | 387 comments)
7. Deploy from local to production (self-hosted) (79 points | 37 comments)
8. Discovering errors in Donald Knuth's TAOCP (132 points | 42 comments)
9. Zig's dot star syntax (value.*) (64 points | 44 comments)
10. MCP vs. API Explained (88 points | 51 comments)
11. Volkswagen reintroducing physical controls for vital functions (311 points | 209 comments)
12. Discworld Rules (178 points | 223 comments)
13. DOGE targets child support database full of income data (8 points | 1 comment)
14. Show HN: TypeLeap: LLM Powered Reactive Intent UI/UX (35 points | 15 comments)
15. The trap of the top-down approach (5 points | discuss)
16. OneText (YC W23) is hiring a browser extension engineer ( | hide)
17. Social Media Posts About Medical Tests with Potential for Overdiagnosis (19 points | 14 comments)
18. Kill your Feeds – Stop letting algorithms dictate what you think (613 points | 236 comments)
19. Time for a Change: The long, contentious history of time shifts (19 points | 15 comments)
20. The program is the database is the interface (143 points | 44 comments)
21. Long Read: Lessons from Building Semantic Search for GitHub and Why I Failed (104 points | 32 comments)
22. Spark-TTS: Text-2-Speech Model Single-Stream Decoupled Tokens [pdf] (50 points | 2 comments)
23. Body Doubling (88 points | 68 comments)
24. Kagi Is Bringing Orion Web Browser to Linux (279 points | 151 comments)
25. Ultrasonic deep drawing cuts friction by 20%, extends tool lifespan (86 points | 27 comments)
26. You might not need Redis (155 points | 100 comments)
27. Stuff a Pi-hole in your router because your browser is about to betray you (72 points | 36 comments)
28. Compared to index funds, actively managed mutual funds still stink (6 points | discuss)
29. An epic treatise on error models for systems programming languages (196 points | 63 comments)
30. Falkon: A KDE Web Browser (178 points | 95 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 9, 2025 at 3:15 AM UTC
